New Records: Shohei Ohtani tied with Ichiro Suzuki for the most stolen bases in a season by a Japanese-born player with 56 stolen bases
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani singled in the go-ahead run before stealing his 56th base of the season in the sixth inning
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a 448-foot shot to tie the game at 3-3 with two outs in the fifth
Mookie Betts followed with a popup to end the inning after Ohtani's single
Michael Kopech earned his 15th save by striking out Donovan Solano swinging on a 101 mph fastball in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers increased their lead over the second-place Padres to three games with four to play and reduced their magic number to two
The Padres' five-game winning streak ended a night after they celebrated making the postseason with a game-ending triple play on their biggest rival's field
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'You want to think about it. It's right in front of us. We'll be ready.'
Padres slugger Fernando Tatis Jr. said, 'We're just going to keep coming. We're definitely going to bring the same energy tomorrow and keep going like that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers scored the tying and go-ahead runs with two outs in the fourth
The sellout crowd of 52,310 chanted 'MVP! MVP!' after Ohtani's double hit the Padres bullpen gate in right
Ohtani leads the major leagues with 130 runs scored, leaving him one shy of the Los Angeles Dodgers record set by Freddie Freeman last season
Others: Dodgers SS Miguel Rojas left the game with left groin tightness and will have an MRI and receive an injection Thursday
Padres RHP Joe Musgrove has thrown six scoreless innings in three of his four outings this month
Dodgers RHP Walker Buehler is still looking for his second win in his final start of the regular season
